title: COVID-19 Virus Test (Current Infection) Result Instructions
description: Information to help interpret and understand the results of your COVID-19 test.
cleaned_text: View instructions on how to view and/or transmit your test results If your test is POSITIVE and you have or had symptoms of COVID-19, you should: If your test is POSITIVE and you have had no symptoms of COVID-19, you should: If your test is POSITIVE, people you live with and your close contacts should: If your test is NEGATIVE and you have or had symptoms of COVID-19, your test result may be a false negative and you could still have COVID-19. Unless a doctor gives you a different diagnosis, you should: If your test is NEGATIVE and you have had no symptoms of COVID-19 Helpful Links
